prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. The euler angles should be set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector should be set to [0.0, 0.5, 0.0]. This will place the coordinate system at the center of the prism, with the x-axis pointing to the right, the y-axis pointing up, and the z-axis pointing out of the page. Next, draw the 2D sketch for part 1 on the x-y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of four straight lines, forming a rectangle. The lines should be defined as follows: - Line 1: Start point [0.0, 0.0], end point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start point [0.75, 0.0], end point [0.75, 0.625] - Line 3: Start point [0.75, 0.625], end point [0.0, 0.625] - Line 4: Start point [0.0, 0.625], end point [0.0, 0.0] The rectangle should have a width of 0.75 units and a height of 0.625 units. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch along the z-axis to a depth of 0.5 units. This will create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. **Part 2: Cutout in the Side of the Prism** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 2. The euler angles should be set to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector should be set to [0.75, 0.0, 0.125]. This will place the coordinate system at the center of the cutout, with the x-axis pointing to the right, the y-axis pointing up, and the z-axis pointing out of the page. Next, draw the 2D sketch for part 2 on the x-y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of three straight lines, forming a right triangle. The lines should be defined as follows: - Line 1: Start point [0.0, 0.0], end point [0.375, 0.5] - Line 2: Start point [0.375, 0.5], end point [0.0, 0.5] - Line 3: Start point [0.0, 0.5], end point [0.0, 0.0] The right triangle should have a base of 0.375 units and a height of 0.5 units. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch along the negative z-axis to a depth of 0.5 units. This will create a cutout in the side of the prism. The final shape should be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cutout in one of the sides. The prism should have a width of 0.75 units, a height of 0.75 units, and a length of 1.25 units (including the cutout). The cutout should have a width of 0.375 units and a height of 0.5 units, and should be located 0.75 units from the left end of the prism and 0.125 units from the front face of the prism.</description>
